title: No intention of banning P-Notes overnight: Revenue Secretary
text: ET SPECIAL: Love visual aspect of news? Enjoy this exclusive slideshows treat! NEW DELHI: Ruling out any overnight ban on Participatory Notes, the government today it is consulting RBI and Sebi on recommendations of the SIT on black money and a "carefully considered decision" will be taken on these instruments. "It is nobody's intention to ban P-Notes overnight. SIT report highlights that there is a need for further improvement in P-Notes regulations," Revenue Secretary Shaktikanta Das said. The government is in the "process of consultation RBI and Sebi on the SIT recommendations on P-Notes", he added. Interactions will also be held with foreign investors, financial institutions and other stakeholders before arriving at a decision. "A covert and carefully considered decision on recommendation of SIT will be taken," he said adding the government will examine how to improve the KYC requirement for P-Notes. Stock market had negatively reacted fearing clampdown on Participatory Notes after a Supreme Court-appointed SIT on black money had suggested a stronger set of norms for such investment instruments.
